meanings.definition: To make a loud sucking noise while eating or drinking.
meanings.sent1: The boy slurped his soup at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: She slurped her milkshake through a straw.
meanings.sent3: The cat slurped up the spaghetti, making a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner slurped up all the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent5: The river slurped noisily as it flowed over the rocks.

meanings.sent1: The toddler slurped his juice from the sippy cup.
meanings.sent2: The dog slurped up the water from its bowl.
meanings.sent3: The engine slurped the gasoline eagerly, as if it was thirsty.
meanings.sent4: The tornado slurped up everything in its path, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The straw slurped the last bits of soda from the cup.
